newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech central bank sets two repo tenders.
newsitem.headline: Czech central bank sets two repo tenders.

text.p: The Czech central bank (CNB) set two repo tenders on Friday to drain liquidity from the market and relieve speculative pressure on the crown.
The CNB, which earlier announced a one-week repo tender, set an overnight repo and a repo for May 27-28.
The CNB did not reveal its maximum rate in the two tenders. The maximum rate in the one-week repo tender was set at 75 percent.
The CNB holds repo tenders to regulate liquidity on the market almost daily. The CNB raised its Lombard rate last Friday to 50 percent from 14 percent.
The CNB has said it would alter the repo rate flexibly according to market conditions.
